intro: Acinodendron reducens, commonly known as the small-fruited acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow as it matures.
